title: Authors and Citation
text: Ushey K (2024). dotty: Destructuring Dot Operator. R package version 0.1.0, https://kevinushey.github.io/dotty/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dotty: The Destructuring Dot Operator},   author = {Kevin Ushey},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://kevinushey.github.io/dotty/}, }

title: The Destructuring Dot Operator
code: library(dotty)  # extract number of rows, number of columns from mtcars .[nr, nc] <- dim(mtcars) c(nr, nc) ## [1] 32 11 # extract first, last element of vector .[first, .., last] <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) c(first, last) ## [1] 1 5 # extract a value by name .[beta = beta] <- list(alpha = 1, beta = 2, gamma = 3) beta ## [1] 2 # unpack nested values .[x, .[y, .[z]]] <- list(1, list(2, list(3))) c(x, y, z) ## [1] 1 2 3 # split version components .[major, minor, patch] <- getRversion() c(major, minor, patch) ## [1] 4 4 1

title: The Destructuring Dot Operator
text: ’d like use dotty CRAN package, can avoid R CMD check warnings including file called R/zzz.R contents: function patches codetools variables usages . expressions can linted though regular bindings / assignments.

title: The Destructuring Dot Operator — .
text: Use `dotty` performed destructuring assignments. Please see examples usages.

title: The Destructuring Dot Operator — .
code: # extract number of rows, number of columns from mtcars .[nr, nc] <- dim(mtcars) c(nr, nc) #> [1] 32 11  # extract first, last element of vector .[first, .., last] <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) c(first, last) #> [1] 1 5  # extract a value by name .[beta = beta] <- list(alpha = 1, beta = 2, gamma = 3) beta #> [1] 2  # unpack nested values .[x, .[y, .[z]]] <- list(1, list(2, list(3))) c(x, y, z) #> [1] 1 2 3  # split version components .[major, minor, patch] <- getRversion() c(major, minor, patch) #> [1] 4 4 1
